    runGame(Set<Integer> winningNumbers)
    compares the numbers of the player to the passed in winning values and evaluates whether or not the player has won any money if he has then the sum is added to the winnings variable aside from this each time you run this it adds two to the spendings

  • Constructor Details

    • LotteryPlayer

      public LotteryPlayer(Integer lotteryMax)
      initialising function for the lottery player object' sets default values for the ID, expenditures, winnings and then gets the player numbers as inputs from the user
      Parameters:
      lotteryMax - is passed in to limit the player from using numbers outside the range

    • LotteryPlayer

      public LotteryPlayer(Integer lotteryMax, Integer ID)
      initialising function for the lottery player object' sets default values for the ID, expenditures, winnings and then gets the player numbers as inputs from the user
      Parameters:
      lotteryMax - is passed in to limit the player from using numbers outside the range
      ID - is automatically passed in by the function creating these to differentiate them for the user

    • runGame

      public void runGame(Set<Integer> winningNumbers)
      compares the numbers of the player to the passed in winning values and evaluates whether or not the player has won any money if he has then the sum is added to the winnings variable aside from this each time you run this it adds two to the spendings
      Parameters:
      winningNumbers - the numbers necessary to win
